title: MediaObject Schema
description: A JSON Schema for the MediaObject credential that represents media objects using schema.org vocabulary.

id.description: The unique identifier for the media object, typically a URI.

schema:name.description: The name or title of the media object.

schema:description.description: A description of the media object.

schema:url.description: The URL of the media object.

schema:contentUrl.description: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

schema:embedUrl.description: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video.

schema:encodingFormat.description: Media type typically expressed using a MIME format.

schema:bitrate.description: The bitrate of the media object.

schema:duration.description: The duration of the item in ISO 8601 duration format.

schema:uploadDate.description: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.

oneOf.description: The height as text.
The width as text.

schema:playerType.description: Player type requiredâ€”for example, Flash or Silverlight.

schema:requiresSubscription.description: Indicates if use of the media requires a subscription.

oneOf.description: The URI of the region.

schema:regionsAllowed.description: The regions where the media is allowed.

oneOf.description: The URI of the eligible region.

id.description: The URI of the eligible region.

schema:name.description: The name of the eligible region.

schema:eligibleRegion.description: The regions where the media is eligible.

oneOf.description: The URI of the ineligible region.

id.description: The URI of the ineligible region.

schema:name.description: The name of the ineligible region.

schema:ineligibleRegion.description: The regions where the media is not eligible.

oneOf.description: The URI of the associated article.

id.description: The URI of the associated article.

schema:name.description: The name of the associated article.

schema:associatedArticle.description: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the encoded creative work.

id.description: The URI of the encoded creative work.

schema:name.description: The name of the encoded creative work.

schema:encodesCreativeWork.description: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the production company.

id.description: The URI of the production company.

schema:name.description: The name of the production company.

schema:productionCompany.description: The production company or studio responsible for the item.

oneOf.description: The URI of the music creator.

id.description: The URI of the music creator.

schema:name.description: The name of the music creator.

oneOf.description: The URI of the author of the media object.

schema:author.description: The author of the media object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the creator of the media object.

schema:creator.description: The creator of the media object.

schema:dateCreated.description: The date and time when the media object was created.

schema:datePublished.description: The date and time when the media object was published.

schema:dateModified.description: The date and time when the media object was last modified.

schema:genre.description: The genre of the media object.

schema:keywords.description: Keywords or tags associated with the media object.

schema:license.description: The license under which the media object is distributed.

schema:inLanguage.description: The language of the media object (ISO 639-1 code).

schema:isAccessibleForFree.description: Whether the media object is accessible for free.

schema:thumbnailUrl.description: The URL of a thumbnail image for the media object.

schema:image.description: The URL of an image representing the media object.

schema:abstract.description: An abstract or summary of the media object.

schema:interactionType.description: The type of interaction being measured.

schema:interactionStatistic.description: Statistics about user interactions with the media object.

schema:isPartOf.description: The URI of a larger creative work of which this media object is a part.

schema:mainEntity.description: The main entity described by this media object.

schema:mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page for which this thing is the main entity being described.

schema:about.description: The subject matter of the media object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the copyright holder.

id.description: The URI of the copyright holder.

schema:name.description: The name of the copyright holder.

schema:copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the media object.

schema:copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the media object was first asserted.

schema:copyrightNotice.description: Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of this media object.

oneOf.description: The content rating as text.

schema:contentRating.description: Official rating of the media object.

schema:commentCount.description: The number of comments this media object has received.

oneOf.description: The URI of the aggregate rating.

schema:aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the media object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the publisher.

schema:publisher.description: The publisher of the media object.

schema:expires.description: Date the media object expires and is no longer useful or available.

oneOf.description: The version number.
The version as text.

schema:version.description: The version of the media object.

schema:text.description: The textual content of this media object.

oneOf.description: The URI of the thumbnail image.

id.description: The URI of the thumbnail image.

schema:name.description: The name of the thumbnail image.

schema:thumbnail.description: Thumbnail image for the media object.

schema:timeRequired.description: Approximate or typical time it usually takes to work with or through the media object.

schema:typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

oneOf.description: The URI of the usage info.

id.description: The URI of the usage info.

schema:name.description: The name of the usage info.

schema:usageInfo.description: Information about the usage of the media object.

schema:accessMode.description: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information.

schema:accessModeSufficient.description: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of the media object.

schema:accessibilityAPI.description: Indicates that the media object is compatible with the referenced accessibility API.

schema:accessibilityControl.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the media object.

schema:accessibilityFeature.description: Content features of the media object, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility.

schema:accessibilityHazard.description: A characteristic of the media object that is physiologically dangerous to some users.

schema:accessibilitySummary.description: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies.

schema:isFamilyFriendly.description: Whether the media object is family friendly.

schema:alternateName.description: An alias for the media object.

oneOf.description: The identifier as text.
The identifier as URI.

schema:identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for the media object.

schema:sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the media object's identity.

oneOf.description: The URI of the potential action.

id.description: The URI of the potential action.

schema:name.description: The name of the potential action.

schema:potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this media object would play an 'object' role.

oneOf.description: The URI of the subject.

schema:subjectOf.description: A CreativeWork or Event about this media object.
